title: British Conservative MPs warned against blocking no-deal Brexit: Sky News
text:
FILE PHOTO: The Houses of Parliament can be seen as a man walks along the South Bank in London, Britain, August 30, 2019. REUTERS/ Henry Nicholls/File Photo

(Reuters) - Britain's Conservative lawmakers have been warned by party officials that their party whip would be withdrawn if they attempt to block a no-deal Brexit, Sky News bit.ly/2HDgmeO reported on Sunday, citing a source.

The lawmakers who have the whip withdrawn are effectively expelled from the party in parliament, meaning they sit as independent candidates.

Prime Minister Boris Johnson conducted a meeting with Conservative whips over lunch on Sunday at his Chequers country retreat, the report said.

Johnson has pledged to deliver Brexit with or without a deal, but several Conservative lawmakers, as well as from opposition parties, want to push through legislation to rule out no-deal before parliament is suspended in just over a week’s time.

Any Conservative MP who fails to vote with the government on Tuesday, when parliament returns from its summer break, will have the whip withdrawn and will not stand as candidates for the party in an election, Sky News reported, citing a senior source from the Tory whips’ office.
